name: delzhand
text: Doctors hate superspinal amputations.

name: relaxing
text: It is the angriest a person can be, to do this

name: pogo
text: The headectomy is a bummer, indeed.

name: mrectomy
text: Someone say my name?

name: bpmead
text: A comment left by bpmead was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Neon, Ariamaki, atticusonline, fuzzyshoo, Xaxx)

name: kestral
text: Ghostface. Much class.

name: closefriend
text: Come to think of it, Caduceus would work both as an 80s hair-band name and an 80s hair-band symbol.

name: connellingus
text: Philippe confuses the Caduceus with the Rod of Asclepius, but then he is five.

name: saru
text: Philippe is five, but there are many people who are not five who have also made this mistake, including the entire Army's medical corps.

name: waldo913
text:
How well would it work for a wine company owned and operated by a rockstar?

www.caduceus.org

name: epicurus
text: The Iraq-Iran solution is exactly the kind of thing I would come up with as a kid. How the hell does Chris do that?

name: joeyramoney
text: chris onstad is actually two six year olds standing one on top of each other under adult clothes.

name: panopticism
text: oh lordy, you just made my day

name: twohundredninety
text: Friday Facts are my favorite strips for just this reason.

name: junko
text: Wonder how much Ray wants for those speakers.

name: deancain29
text: email him for details

name: clever-nickname
text: I love the idea of someone taking notes using a Burnt Sienna-coloured crayola crayon.

name: deusoma
text: In Grade 5, I once left my pencil case at home and took notes for most of a day with a purple pencil crayon. Does that count?

name: tekende
text: hahaha pencil case.

name: soticoto
text:
You "took notes" in "Grade 5"?
What kinda screwy school did you go to?

name: aelindil
text:
In deusoma's defense, I once attended a school that taught Latin in grade 5.

I left after grade 4.

name: deusoma
text: Catholic elementary school. The "notes" probably consisted of something they made us copy word for word from the board, but yeah. There was writing involved.

name: soticoto
text: Wasn't "writing" what people did before the invention of the personal computer?

name: bixschmix
text: They taught me HTML in 5th grade... many of my adult neuroses and geekiness could be traced to this event.

name: cpnglxynchos
text: Prodigy is responsible for my computer-ness.

name: sex_bicycle
text: No wonder the american schools are screwed I took notes from like first class (about 7 years old) would have just been of the board but notes are pretty basic >.<

name: love_is_so_punk
text: I didn't start taking notes until college.  Up until then, just paying attention was enough to get high scores on every test.

name: spinynorman
text: Never before have I ever been compelled to laugh at something as simple as a pair of speakers.

name: sp1derbaby
text: Ray looks so optimistic!

name: tfaironpirate
text: It's 'cause you're HI.

name: rowboat
text: Anybody understand the alt text? Google doesn't. I don't wanna be left out.

name: pogo
text: Yes, it is an extension of the "weird Bible names" joke in the third item, where "Belshazzar" heals "Gonsson" with a mustard poltice, according to trusted source L.B.

name: rowboat
text: But what about Password Mountain?

name: pogo
text: That is a head-scratcher.  I guess when I first saw "Passowrd Mounain," I just thought that all these strange Bible names could be used as passwords.  Now I'm not so sure.

name: foea
text: It's part of L.B.'s made-up bible story.

name: fineoakstructure
text: Lie Bot probably just ripped it off from one of Nice Pete's fan-fics.

name: l_c_b
text: Do you think the speakers are still available? Man, I hope so.

name: cpnglxynchos
text: email him for details.

name: jthm_guitarist
text: A comment left by jthm_guitarist was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by shammack, Art-Vader, jeffreyquah)

name: achilleselbow
text: Thanks, we might have missed that the first 100 times it was pointed out.

name: achilleselbow
text: I know that the quahog is a real clam and all apart from the show, but I'm having trouble believing that Onstad wasn't at least subconsciously channeling Family Guy.

name: geysershitdick
text: That's weird because I have a really easy time believing that.

name: swatson
text: Would one of you boys mind telling me the highlights of this page seeing as I'm a girl and not allowed. :)

name: ananke
text: Yes, half the world is waiting for the word.  What IS up on that back page?

name: echidnaboy
text: i can't tell you much, but here's the gist: boys are wicked and girls are rubbish.

text: Psst girls have cooties pass it on

text: Ray just looks so happy!

text: why not yell at worms? If they can change once they might do it again.
